title: 100 Copies ‘Wheels of Change’ Prints
content:
The latest print from 100 Copies, entitled ‘Wheels of Change‘ illustrates a cyclist riding against the crack line of an iceberg, sealing it with every pedal stroke. This symbolizes how riding a bike represents our ability to make a positive environmental impact through simple, everyday actions.

The poster, crafted from torn pieces of recycled paper, is meticulously pieced together to depict a fractured iceberg. The artwork was then captured through a high-resolution flat scan. The cyclist signifies a step towards a healthier planet. Wheeling for a better world.

Specs:
Sheet size: 840mm X 594mm (A1)
Print Quality: Offset Lithographic Printing uses 2 Pantone Spot Colours to ensure colour accuracy and a high-quality print.
Printed On: 220gsm Maple Bright paper, suitable for archival use.

Check out more at 100 Copies.

The post 100 Copies ‘Wheels of Change’ Prints appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
